Description.val:
The Submarine Broadcast Support program was established to improve the reliability, availability, maintainability, efficiency and performance of the Very Low Frequency (VLF) and Low Frequency (LF) submarine broadcast systems. These transmission mediums, VLF/LF, comprise the primary line of Fleet Ballistic Missile Nuclear Command, Control and Communications (NC3). Shore based transmitter sites are Emergency Action Message relay points providing primary connectivity between the Senior Leadership and Ship Submersible Ballistic Nuclear (SSBN) Submarines. Upgrades to shore infrastructure include integrating Internet Protocol capability in Broadcast Control Authority sites.

[P5 / W4008 Transmission Equipment]: Transmission Equipment program will modernize the aging and obsolete components of the submarine broadcast transmission system, to include components located at the Broadcast Transmitter Stations (BTSs), Broadcast Keying Stations (BKSs), and the Broadcast Control Authority (BCA) sites.

[P5 / W4009 Low Band Universal Communications System (LBUCS), Receive]: LBUCS is a modernization program that will upgrade receive subsystems of the Fixed Submarine Broadcast System (FSBS) which are approaching their operational end of life. LBUCS will ensure operational capability through the VLF architecture by providing system life extension and flexibility of submarine broadcast traffic to submarines operating in a stealth posture.

[P5 / W4010 Messaging Nuclear Command Control Communications (NC3) Hybrid Solution (HS) NOVA/NIXT]: Messaging NC3 (NIXT) will provide accurate and reliable delivery of time-critical messages for command and control of nuclear forces in a pre-attack environment for force direction, force management, situation monitoring and planning. Messaging NC3 HS Nova/NIXT will upgrade the Nova hubsites, backbone and procure and field the NIXT to replace end-of-life legacy user terminals at shore communications stations.

[P3A / W4009 Low Band Universal Communications System (LBUCS) Transmit]: LBUCS Transmit will modernize the transmit subsystem hardware, software and waveform components at Broadcast Keying Stations (BKSs), Broadcast Transmitter Station (BTSs) and Broadcast Control Authority (BCA) sites including the Very Low Frequency (VLF) Broadcast Builder, AN/URT-30B Integrated VLF Transmit Terminal (IVTT), IVTT Proxy, the MD-1310 Modulator, and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) Interoperable Submarine Broadcast System (NISBS).

Justification.val:
LBUCS Transmit: FY15 funding will provide for the procurement of LBUCS Transmit Low Rate Initial Production (LRIP) units.
Submarine Broadcast Support: FY15 Funding will provide for the procurement and installation of the bushings.
NOVA/NIXT: FY15 funding will provide for the procurement and installation of NIXT systems.

Name.@footnote: Transmission Equipment funds the LaMoure modernization, Bushings, Insulators, and other equipment used in Submarine Broadcast. Unit costs vary due to unique equipment and site configurations.
Installation costs vary due to unique site configurations.

Name.val: W4010 Messaging Nuclear Command Control Communications (NC3) Hybrid Solution (HS) NOVA/NIXT

Name.@footnote: Unit cost fluctuation is due to procurement of variable systems to support Nova configurations
Unit cost fluctuation is due to procurement of variable systems to support NIXT configurations.

3 units are being installed in FY14, 2 Nova units installed in FY15 were procured in FY14.  The delivery time from first delivery to second delivery is 7 months which is outside of the allowable 15 month installation policy, therefore FY15 funds are used to install product from the second delivery
DSA funding supports development of installation drawings.

Data logistics funds the initial logistics package and deficiency corrections post install.

Title.val: W4009 Low Band Universal Communications System (LBUCS) Transmit

Name.@footnote: Production costs for Broadcast Keying Station (BKS) equipment vary due to unique site configuration and mix on Continental United Stats (CONUS) and OCONUS locations.  Cost and duration for BKS installations are greater than Broadcast Transmitter Station (BTS) due to complexity of the BKS system.   Install costs for BKS equipment vary due to unique site configuration and mix on Continental United Stats (CONUS) and OCONUS locations.  BKS Low Rate Initial Production (LRIP) units are more expensive to procure and install due to unique configuration of the receiving sites.     LBUCS Transmit equipment and cables will be installed in racks and must go through acceptance and integration testing prior to installation outbrief.

Production costs for Broadcast Transmitter Station (BTS) equipment vary due to unique site configuration and mix on Continental United States (CONUS) and Outside Continental United States (OCONUS) locations.  Install costs for BTS equipment vary due to unique site configuration and mix on CONUS and OCONUS locations.  LBUCS Transmit equipment and cables will be installed in racks and must go through acceptance and integration testing prior to installation outbrief.

Description.val:
LBUCS Transmit will modernize the transmit subsystem hardware, software and waveform components at Broadcast Keying Stations (BKSs), Broadcast Transmitter Stations (BTSs) and Broadcast Control Authority (BCA) sites including the Very Low Frequency (VLF) Broadcast Builder, AN/URT-30B Integrated VLF Transmit Terminal (IVTT), IVTT Proxy, the MD-1310 Modulator, and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) Interoperable Submarine Broadcast System (NISBS).

LBUCS Milestone C review and approval has slipped from 2nd qtr of 2014 to 3rd qtr of FY14. Related RDTE PE: 0101402N
